text: Death from Afar
It's hard to aim with only one eye, but the Fimir still use limited numbers of ranged troops.
Born to Fight
Crude they may be, the skill and might of the Fimir Warriors makes them terrifying opponents.
Swift Raiders

Fimir aren’t the fastest creatures, but they understand the value of mobility on the battlefield. Therefore, they tame the faster, corrupted, and dangerous beasts of their swampland homes to gain a tactical advantage.
Creatures of the Dark Bogs
The Fimir aren’t the only monsters inhabiting the swamps. Weaker or small-minded creatures are subjugated and used to bolster the ranks of Fimir armies.
Pride of the Caste
The larger and stronger Fimir are used as shock troops, with devastating effect on the enemy.
Terrors from the Fens
Fimir are often accompanied by bigger, more terrifying swamp dwellers. Make no mistake though, the Fimir are the masters of these creatures and will use them with ruthless cunning.
Masters of Battle
Few can hope to overcome the veterans of the warrior caste in battle. Luckily, they are few in number.
Deadly Devourers
Starved monsters, driven by hatred and hunger. They will fight with reckless abandon against the foes of the Fimir.
Experienced Raiders
Fimir are not famous for their hit and run tactics, partly because only a few who encounter them live to tell the tale.
Heralds of Doom
Nothing brings fear to the heart like the trembling of the ground these abominations cause with every step.
Worthless Slaves
They have no worth. Their lives have no worth. They merely exist to die for the dark gods. Now drown your enemies in a tide of bodies.
Warrior Elite
The elite of the Fimir warrior caste are unmatched in skill. Luckily for the civilized races, the Fimir can rarely afford to field many of such might at once.
Untamed Monstrosities
The Fimir sometimes leave the will of captured beasts unbroken, releasing them ahead of the army to sow havoc. This tactic preserves their natural ferocity, but makes them difficult to control.
From the Mists
From the mists they came, unseen until it was too late. And in the mist they vanished again, once their bloody work was done.
Under the Eyes of the Gods
The Fimir will do anything for but a moment of attention from the Dark Gods. No act of bravery is too foolhardy, no act of cruelty too savage.
Ambitious Elites
Many mighty champions have flocked to Bel'akors banner, always honing their own skill in battle to serve their Dark Master and reap the promised rewards.
Pretender Hell-Mother

Having been ousted from her fortress at Schadensumpf by the ever-encroaching humans, Skattach has descended into insanity. Having regrouped in the misty coasts of the northern Wastelands, she has crowned herself Hell-Mother, ruler of all Fimir.
Ancient Leadership
The Meargh are the respected and feared witch-queens of the Fimir. Skattach is at her prime as a Meargh, having ruled over her Clan for 800 hundred years.
Skattach's Fianna

From the moment took on the hated mantle of the Fimir Hell-Mother, Skattach keeps a personal guard of the most elite, skilled and loyal Fianna Fimm of her clan, lest any ambitious Dirach gets the wrong idea and tries to replace her with a more pliable Meargh.
Poison Mist
All Meargs naturally exude a magical mist that poisons and dazes all non-Fimir. Skattach's Mist is a particularly noxious one.
Skattach's Megalomania

After surviving an assassination attempt by one of her own Dirach advisers and subsequently being driven from her ancestral stronghold by humans, Skattach has descended into such a state of crazed megalomania that it has further empowered her already considerable magical abilities and natural resilience.
Witch-Queen of the Fimir
Being one of the Meargh, Skattach is a fearsome sorceress, able to easily manipulate the Winds of Magic, and even lend some of her arcane acumen to the lesser Dirach males.
Master Daemonologist

Fimir possess a natural aptitude for summoning daemons, said to come from their half-daemonic heritage. The Meargh summon them with ease, casually binding thousands of lesser daemons each day to serve as servants and warriors.
Staff of Balor's Eye

At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as Balor’s Eye - a magically preserved eye said to belong to the mysterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user’s enemies within.
Crown of the Hell-Mother

This thorny metal crown once belonged to the First Hell-Mother - a Meargh who united all the ancient Fimir clans. She was a potent sorceress who placed many warding and magic-amplifying enchantments upon her crown. Skattach recently rediscovered it in what she claims to be the ruins of the Wandering Isle, the ancient lost homeland of the Fimir, and used it to claim the controversial mantle of the Hell-Mother.
Boglar Shamans are often gifted Moor Hounds by the Fimir. Such gifts can serve as either reward or punishment - if the Hound devours the Shaman, it was a punishment; if the Shaman tames it, a reward.
Moor Hound
The highest-ranking nobles often ride into battle atop mighty Bog Beasts.
Bog Beast
The All-Mother

A being as ancient as the world possessing great malice and intellect, Kroll is a Daemon Princess unaligned to any of the Great Powers, and worshipped as mother of the Bog Octopuses and ruler of the cursed bogs by the Fimir.
Kroll Skills
Mother of a Thousand Young

Ever the nurturing mother, Kroll's love for her children has no bounds, as she devours foes, all those she considers her progeny - Fimir, Bog Octopuses and others - are fed the regurgigated remains and revitalised.
Nameless Thing

Kroll has survived for aeons, and the Fimir claim she's as old as the world itself. Whatever the truth, the many weapons and trinkets of would-be slayers that cover her form can attest to her endurance.
Terrible Tentacles
The grip of Kroll's colossal tentacles has such strenght that it can crush armour, flesh and bones in a matter of seconds. No foe who has been trapped in her embrace has lived to tell the tale.
Bog Matriarch

In the presence of Kroll, both her earthly children - the Bog Octopuses - and the other supernatural denizens of the marsh fight with greater cunning and ferocity, for now they are guided not by instinct alone, but by the will of the Great Mother.
Broodmother

Kroll has been known to implant her magical eggs in the bodies of her still living prey, eggs which then grow quickly feeding on the soul essence of the victim, ending with a Bog Octopus hatchling busting out of the doomed victim.
Daemon Princess of the Fimir

Whatever the truth of her origins, it is certain that Kroll is now a creature of the Empyrean, and that the worship and sacrifices dedicated to her greatly empower her physical form. Beholden to none of the Four, Kroll plans to one day achieve her own apotheosis as goddess of the Fimir.
Throne of the Hell-Mother

Whether it is the genuine article or a replica made for her is unknown, but Skattach claims it to be the original throne of the mythical Hell-Mother, ruler of all Fimir. It is borne aloft by four of Skattach’s most trusted Fianna Guardians.
Throne of the Hell-Mother

Whether it is the genuine article or a replica made for her is unknown, but Skattach claims it to be the original throne of the mythical Hell-Mother, ruler of all Fimir. It is borne aloft by four of Skattach’s most trusted Fianna Guardians.
Mount: Throne of the Hell-Mother
Devoted of Fimúl
No act of faith among the Fimir rivals the sacrifice of captured slaves - a dark and twisted offering to the Mud-Father Fimúl and his children.
